intro: Cordyline chelsonii, commonly known as the New Zealand cabbage tree, is a striking evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, sword-shaped leaves. The plant can grow up to 10 meters in height, with a distinctive crown of broad, dark green foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a valuable addition to both gardens and landscapes.
